result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: requesting ignition interlock exemption

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court, in custody, with Attorney Eric D Lowenberg.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are ready to proceed with sentencing.
Gail Niedziejko, victim, made statements to the court.   Defendant, son, responded to victim (mother).   

Court orders the following:  Count 1
- 150 straight time  with huber privileges and standard releases to begin immediately.   Court gives 76 days credit.
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail
- Restitution of $45.00 to victim, Gail Niedziejko.
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. Contact with mother and sister at the victim's discretion. Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. Be compliant with all orders of the court with competent jurisdiction.

Court orders the following: Count 2 
- 6 months straight time STAYED for 18 months  Probation - concurrent to Count 3
- Court costs of $343.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation; alternate 7 days jail
- Restitution $440.00 
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. Contact with mother and sister at the victim's discretion. Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. Be compliant with all orders of the court with competent jurisdiction.

Court orders the following: Count 3 
- 90 days straight time STAYED for 18 months  Probation - concurrent to Count 2
- Court costs of $343.00 to be paid as a condition of Probation; alternate 7 days jail
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school. Contact with mother and sister at the victim's discretion. Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. Be compliant with all orders of the court with competent jurisdiction.
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
with jury instructions

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court, in custody, with Attorney Eric D Lowenberg.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer is placed on the record.
Court performs the plea colloque with the defendant.   Court enters a plea of guilty to Counts 1, 2 and 3 of the amended information.
Court finds the defendant guilty.
Sentencing recommendations are made.

Court adjourns for sentencing as court was information that the victims wish to speak at sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
For Reduction of Bail, filed by Atty Lowenberg with an affidavit of mailing and cover letter.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court, in custody, with attorney Eric D Lowenberg.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses bail motion that was filed. Court denies bail motion. Court will put the matter on the calendar for a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court, in custody, with attorney Eric D Lowenberg.   Barbara A Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for bail reduction addressed. Defense presents statements. State opposes bail modification. Court orders bail to remain as fixed. Atty. Lowenberg requests a brief adjournment. There may be additional charges. Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
For Reduction of Bail, filed by Atty Lowenberg along with an affidavit of mailing and cover letter.
Hearing on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion.   Preliminary Hearing requested  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Gail N. or Michelle N. or their residence in New Berlin.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jeffrey R Niedziejko in court, in custody.  Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised court that he had Attorney Cotter, but Attorney Cotter advised him that he no longer takes criminal cases.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
